intro: Acronia orecta, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Acronia orecta is known for its vibrant red or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
